column4: Binky1:i have an old toughbook it can only handle a 800x600 resolution.
Binky1:my acer aspire one can only handle a 1078x600 resolution.
Binky1:what graphics chipset are you using?
pull up a terminal and type lspci
look for the graphics card
Binky1:it all depends on your graphics card
lzrdking:what chipset are you using?
lzrdking:imean drivers?
lzrdking:is it the deafault drivers?
walkabouting:why would you do that?
work
you mean one for work one for play?
walkabouting:could you just set up another profile in xp?
basically
no, I need to periodically format windows - it gets bloated in ~3months. its more one for work, one for testing
walkabouting:so that when it boots it'll give you an option to either boot into work or play?
yes - stable xp, testing xp, or linux
how about virtualbox?
too slow
what are your system specs?
it shouldnt be *that* hard - I could do it in grub, but grub2 is way too confusing
try adding more ram.
